column5: Discover the principles and technologies that have led to biomedical engineering becoming essential in healthcare, medicine and human biology. Suitable for intercalating medical students and graduates in life sciences, this master's degree combines knowledge of biomechanics and fluid mechanics in the human body with engineering design innovations.INTRODUCTIONBiomedical engineering, the application of engineering knowledge and skills to healthcare, medicine and human biology, is the fastest growing engineering discipline worldwide.
column7: UK fees (applies to Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland) Full-time place, per year - £11,950  International fees Full-time place, per year - £26,350
